basics.name: Kai Garcia
basics.label: Software Engineer | Student
basics.summary: I am studying Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. At work I create and manage software for a publishing company, mainly using the LAMP development stack.

highlights: Refactored obsolete and undocumented LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) projects to modernize payment tracking features; assisting in generating over $100,000 in revenue.

Overhauled engineering team workflow; implemented local test environment for existing products, improved version control (team was using single main branch), transitioned from document to Kanban-style task tracking.
Worked closely with nontechnical management to solidify unclear feature requests; proposed designs, turned requests into actionable tasks, negotiated due dates, and effectively delivered on time.

Conducted interviews and training for incoming developers, assessed technical skills and cultural fit, and introduced backlog grooming and pair programming practices to build and lead a strong and capable software engineering team.
Run workshops to teach entrepreneurs how to build prototypes for their ventures.
Manage inventory and budget for supplies and program costs.
10-week course in foundational AI concepts, machine learning, and ethics.
Collaborated to develop and train machine learning models using Python.

Explored real-world applications of AI, such as computer vision, natural language
processing, and robotics.
